insights.root_cause: The variations in outstanding balances may be due to irregular payment patterns or errors in transaction recording.
insights.recommendation: Review transaction logs and payment schedules for inconsistencies.

insights.bucket_description: Consistent increase or decrease in outstanding balances
insights.root_cause: This trend might be caused by systematic errors in billing or changes in customer payment behavior.
insights.recommendation: Investigate billing processes and customer payment trends to identify underlying issues.

insights.bucket_description: Outstanding balances are not in line with previous months
insights.root_cause: There may be errors in monthly closing processes or unusual transactions impacting balances.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a detailed review of monthly closing entries and transactions.

insights.root_cause: Reversal or correction entries could be due to prior period adjustments or error rectifications.
insights.recommendation: Verify the legitimacy of reversal or correction entries and ensure proper documentation.

insights.bucket_description: High volatility in account balances over time
insights.root_cause: Volatility may result from fluctuating transaction volumes or external economic factors.
insights.recommendation: Analyze transaction patterns and external factors influencing account balances.

insights.bucket_description: No clear pattern, but deviation exceeds threshold
insights.root_cause: Random deviations may be due to isolated incidents or errors that do not follow a pattern.
insights.recommendation: Perform a thorough investigation of these deviations to identify any isolated issues.
